definitions.definition: To detect the scent of; to discern by the sense of smell.
examples: The hounds scented the fox in the woods.

definitions.definition: To inhale in order to detect the scent of (something).
To have a suspicion of; to detect the possibility of (something).
examples: I scented trouble when I saw them running down the hill towards me.

definitions.definition: To impart an odour to, to cause to have a particular smell.
examples: Scent the air with burning sage before you begin your meditation.

definitions.definition: To have a smell; ( figuratively ) to give an impression ( of something).
To hunt animals by means of the sense of smell.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To detect the scent of; to discern by the sense of smell.
secondary_definitions: ( ambitransitive ) To inhale in order to detect the scent of (something).
( transitive , figurative ) To have a suspicion of; to detect the possibility of (something).
( transitive ) To impart an odour to, to cause to have a particular smell.
( intransitive , obsolete ) To have a smell; ( figuratively ) to give an impression ( of something).
To hunt animals by means of the sense of smell.
